document.title: Logging Functions
document.synopsis: Functions associated with reading or writing log data.

function.name: status
function.synopsis: Saves a message to the status log
function.note: If a database connection is available, this message is written to the # log table, otherwise it is written to logs/status.log

function.name: error
function.synopsis: Saves a message to the error log
function.note: If a database connection is available, this message is written to the log table, otherwise it is written to logs/error.log

function.name: _message
function.synopsis: Saves a message to a log.
function.note: If a database connection is available, this message is written to the log table, otherwise it is written to the logs/ directory
This function is used internally by the Oyster library and should only be used by modules if you wish to create custom message types. Use log_status() and log_error() instead.
This function is not exported by default, to use it you must call it by its fully qualified name.
